comments:
After trying to run as SWT application, I got this stacktrace on the console:

===============================================================
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Argument cannot be null
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3358)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3297)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3268)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.ImageLoader.load(ImageLoader.java:125)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.ImageDataLoader.load(ImageDataLoader.java:22)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.ImageData.<init>(ImageData.java:328)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image.<init>(Image.java:545)
	at ***.graphical.UMLClassFigureTest.main(UMLClassFigureTest.java:32)
===============================================================

A click on any of the underlined source locations (like ImageData.java:328) results in an error when junitsrc.zip is trying to be located in the plugin org.eclipse.jdt.source_3.1.1. I don't understand why that is necessary here but in my eclipse/plugins folder there is the jdt.source plugin in version org.eclipse.jdt.source_3.2.0.v20060602-0010-F7snq0fulF-UQcP

I tried to reproduce the error when launching another eclipse instance in debug mode with all plugins but the error did not occur.

It sounds like you have a messed up launch configuration, since your eclipse installation has the 3.2 plugin for jdt.source and it says that your source locator is looking for the 3.1.1 jdt.source.

Could you have a look at the build path for the project and the source tab for the launch configuration to see if there are any items that should not be there anymore or that point to no longer available resources?

(In reply to comment #1)
> It sounds like you have a messed up launch configuration, since your eclipse
> installation has the 3.2 plugin for jdt.source and it says that your source
> locator is looking for the 3.1.1 jdt.source.
> 
> Could you have a look at the build path for the project and the source tab for
> the launch configuration to see if there are any items that should not be there
> anymore or that point to no longer available resources?
> 

The build path looks fine. No problems indicated and no dependency refers to 3.1.1. 
I imported the project to a fresh workspace with the same eclipse installation and it worked. So I searched in the .metadata folder of the corrupt workspace for "org.eclipse.jdt.source_3.1.1" as file content with no result.

Strange.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 138877 ***

traces.message: Das System kann den angegebenen Pfad nicht finden
